trans-unit.source: Represents fault detail information.

The <xref:System.ServiceModel.ExceptionDetail> class is the type parameter used as the fault detail object when a <xref:System.ServiceModel.FaultException?displayProperty=fullName> is sent by a service as a result of setting the <xref:System.ServiceModel.ServiceBehaviorAttribute.IncludeExceptionDetailInFaults%2A?displayProperty=fullName> or the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.ServiceDebugBehavior.IncludeExceptionDetailInFaults%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property to `true`.
To send a <xref:System.ServiceModel.ExceptionDetail> object the type must be serializable.
For more information on serialization options, see [Specifying Data Transfer in Service Contracts](~/docs/framework/wcf/feature-details/specifying-data-transfer-in-service-contracts.md).
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.ExceptionDetail"></xref> class from the exception.
The help link, message, stack trace, and type name information is extracted and added to the equivalent properties in <xref:System.ServiceModel.ExceptionDetail>.
The exception to be serialized as an <xref href="System.ServiceModel.ExceptionDetail"></xref> object.
The exception parameter is `null`.
Gets or sets the help link from the exception passed to the constructor.
The return value, which represents a help file, is a URN or URL.
The help link information of the exception.
Gets or sets the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.ExceptionDetail"></xref> object that represents the inner exception.
Use the <xref:System.ServiceModel.ExceptionDetail.InnerException%2A> property to obtain the set of exceptions that led to the current exception.
The inner exception information.
Gets or sets the message from the exception passed to the constructor.
The text of <xref:System.ServiceModel.ExceptionDetail.Message%2A> should completely describe the error and should, when possible, explain how to correct it.
The exception message.
Gets or sets the stack trace information from the exception passed to the constructor.
The execution stack keeps track of all the methods that are in execution at a given instant.
A trace of the method calls is called a stack trace.
The stack trace of the exception.
Returns the exception detail information for the exception passed to the constructor.
The message and stack trace of the exception.
Gets or sets the type string for the exception passed to the constructor.
The type string for the exception passed to the constructor.
